definition: to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: These kinds of jinn can be killed with date or plum stones fired from a sling.
sentences.chinese: 可以用彈弓發射棗核或者李子核射殺這幾種精靈。

sentences.english: Player must shoot the attackers of zombi .
sentences.chinese: 玩家必須射殺那些喪屍。

sentences.english: Alexis approaches Carroll and shoots him.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷克西斯走近凱文，射殺了他。

sentences.english: The natives use poisoned arrows to kill big game.
sentences.chinese: 土著用毒箭射殺大獵物。

sentences.english: Jack directs Jessie not to shoot the suspect because he needs him alive.
sentences.chinese: 傑克指示傑西不要射殺嫌犯，他需要活捉嫌犯。

sentences.english: Lester is accused of fatally shooting 36-year-old Ronald E.
sentences.chinese: 萊斯特被控射殺36歲的羅納德東施拉特。

sentences.english: North Korea threatened to shoot at the speakers earlier this year.
sentences.chinese: 北朝鮮今年早些時候威脅要射殺這些喊話者。

sentences.english: Hunters are shooting their guns at the geese.
sentences.chinese: 獵人正在開槍射殺這些野雁。

sentences.english: How long does Cally spend in the brig for shooting Sharon?
sentences.chinese: 由於射殺了沙倫，凱莉在牢裏呆了多久？

sentences.english: At his wedding to Lorna, a vindictive Carver shoots the bride.
sentences.chinese: 在他與羅娜的婚禮上，心懷怨恨的卡弗射殺了新娘。

sentences.english: She has Oren's driver shoot him for his failure.
sentences.chinese: 因爲歐倫的失敗，她叫歐倫的司機射殺了他。

sentences.english: This was after a white bear with patches of brown fur was shot by hunters.
sentences.chinese: 當時獵人們射殺了一隻長着棕色斑塊皮毛白熊。

sentences.english: As he releases Victor, Andre shoots DeSalvo anyway.
sentences.chinese: 他這邊放下了維克多，那邊安德烈還是射殺了迪沙佛。

sentences.english: I do not even hate the Talib who shot me.
sentences.chinese: 我甚至不怨恨射殺我的塔利班成員。

sentences.english: Brenton was shot as he was sitting in a police vehicle on the night of Halloween.
sentences.chinese: Brenton是萬聖節當晚在警車中被射殺的。

definition: to rake with machine gunfire/to strafe/to machine-gun down
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
to attack with a bladed weapon
to be wounded/to sustain an injury
